(1, 1, 1): Shiraz, (Buyids of Fars, 934-1062), Ray, (Buyids of Jibal, 943-1029), Baghdad, (Buyids of Iraq, 945-1055)
(2, 1, 1): Arabic (official and court language; lingua franca), Middle Persian (secondary court language), Persian (popular), Daylami (native)
(3, 1, 1): Shia Islam, (also Sunni, Mu'tazila Islam, Christianity, Zoroastrianism, Judaism)
(11, 0, 1): Adud al-Dawla becomes the supreme ruler of the Buyid dynasty
